title: Interests
text:
Note



üå± Overview
This page highlights key areas I enjoy exploring beyond my core modules. These interests reflect my curiosity, learning habits, and how I approach problem-solving in both academic and personal contexts.
My interests reflect a mix of technology, finance, and personal growth, and they influence how I plan my learning, approach projects, and develop long-term skills.

title: Interests
text:
1) Financial Technology (FinTech)
I am interested in how technology can make financial services more efficient, secure, and accessible. FinTech appeals to me because it combines technical challenges with real-world impact.
In particular, I enjoy learning about: - Digital payments & financial platforms ‚Äî how systems handle speed, scale, and reliability
- Risk and fraud detection ‚Äî using data patterns to identify unusual behaviour
- Personal finance & automation ‚Äî tools that support better financial decision-making
Why this matters to me:
FinTech operates at the intersection of technology and everyday life. Understanding these systems motivates me to learn how reliable and user-focused solutions are designed.







Tip



üí° Key takeaway:
Well-designed financial systems require both strong technical foundations and an understanding of user needs.

title: Interests
text:
2) Data Analytics & Visualisation
I enjoy analysing data and transforming it into insights that are clear, accurate, and easy to understand.
Some aspects I find particularly engaging include: - Cleaning and structuring messy datasets
- Choosing appropriate visuals based on the purpose (trend, comparison, relationship)
- Writing concise explanations that help non-technical audiences interpret results
How it helps me:
This interest strengthens my ability to support decisions with evidence and communicate findings effectively, which is valuable in both technical and collaborative environments.

title: Interests
text:
3) Software Development & Problem-Solving
I enjoy building practical solutions through programming and iterative improvement.
This includes: - Writing clean, readable, and maintainable code
- Debugging issues systematically
- Designing small features that solve specific problems
How it helps me:
Software development trains my logical thinking and attention to detail, while also teaching patience and persistence when solving complex problems.







Note



üõ†Ô∏è Learning mindset:
I view challenges in coding as opportunities to improve both my technical skills and problem-solving approach.

title: Interests
text:
4) Continuous Learning & Growth
I value consistent and reflective learning over last-minute memorisation. My preferred learning habits include: - Keeping concise notes (commands, templates, common mistakes)
- Practising through small tasks rather than only reading theory
- Reflecting on what worked and what could be improved after each assignment
How it helps me:
These habits help me stay organised, reduce repeated mistakes, and steadily improve across different modules and projects.

title: Interests
text:
5) Personal Interest: Pets üêæ
I have a personal interest in animals, especially dogs and cats. While I do not currently own a pet, I enjoy being around pets because they create a calm and positive environment.
What I appreciate about pets: - They reduce stress and improve mood
- They encourage empathy and patience
- They remind me to slow down and maintain balance during busy periods

Being around animals provides a sense of calm and emotional comfort, helping me manage stress during academically demanding periods. I believe that positive human‚Äìanimal interactions contribute to mental well-being and promote empathy and patience.

title: My Travel Experience
text:
Note



üåè Overview
This page reflects on my travel experience in Japan and how it contributed to my cultural awareness, adaptability, and learning beyond the classroom.

title: My Travel Experience
text:
For me, travel is not only about leisure, but also about: - Experiencing different cultures and lifestyles
- Observing how people interact with their environment
- Learning to adapt to unfamiliar situations
- Developing independence and confidence
These experiences have influenced how I approach challenges in both academic and personal settings.

title: My Travel Experience
text:
During my travels, I had the opportunity to experience diverse cultures, traditions, and social norms.
Observing how people from different backgrounds communicate and solve everyday problems helped me develop greater cultural awareness and respect for diversity.
This exposure has made me more open-minded and improved my ability to work effectively in team settings with people from different backgrounds.




Travel often requires adapting to unexpected situations, such as: - Navigating unfamiliar transportation systems
- Managing time and schedules independently
- Overcoming language or communication barriers
These experiences strengthened my problem-solving skills, patience, and ability to remain calm under pressure‚Äîskills that are highly relevant to project work and real-world computing tasks.




Planning trips, managing budgets, and making decisions independently helped me become more confident and self-reliant.
Travel taught me the importance of preparation while also embracing flexibility when plans change.
This mindset has positively influenced how I manage academic deadlines, group projects, and long-term goals.

title: My Travel Experience
text:
The lessons gained from travel translate directly into my academic journey:

Improved adaptability when learning new technical concepts

Stronger communication and teamwork skills

Better time management and planning

Greater appreciation for global perspectives in technology and finance

In the context of Applied Computing and FinTech, understanding diverse user needs and global systems is increasingly important.

title: My Travel Experience
text:
Overall, travel has helped me grow beyond the classroom by exposing me to new perspectives and challenges.
These experiences continue to shape how I learn, collaborate, and approach problem-solving in my academic and future professional journey.

title: My Travel Experience
text:
In the future, I hope to: - Explore more countries and cultures
- Learn how technology is used differently across regions
- Continue developing a global mindset that complements my technical skills

title: My Travel Experience
text:
Cultural Exposure and Daily Life
Japan stood out to me for its emphasis on discipline, respect, and efficiency.
From public transportation to everyday interactions, I observed how small habits‚Äîsuch as punctuality, cleanliness, and consideration for others‚Äîcontribute to an orderly and comfortable society.
These observations helped me appreciate how thoughtful system design, whether social or technological, can significantly improve user experience.

title: My Travel Experience
text:
Iconic Sights and Places
During my visit, I explored several well-known landmarks and city areas.
These places highlighted Japan‚Äôs ability to preserve tradition while embracing modern development.
Some memorable sights included: - Bustling cityscapes with advanced infrastructure
- Traditional streets and temples that reflect historical values
- Public spaces designed with both functionality and aesthetics in mind
Experiencing these places helped me understand the importance of balance between innovation and heritage.

title: My Travel Experience
text:
Food Culture and Culinary Experience
Japanese food culture was one of the most enjoyable aspects of the trip.
Meals were not only about taste but also about presentation, balance, and attention to detail.
I enjoyed experiencing a wide range of dishes, from casual street food to carefully prepared meals. The consistency and quality of food reflected Japan‚Äôs strong emphasis on craftsmanship and pride in work.

title: My Travel Experience
text:
Lessons from Japanese Food Culture
What stood out to me about Japanese cuisine: - Strong focus on freshness and quality
- Careful presentation that enhances the dining experience
- Respect for ingredients and cooking processes
These values resonated with me, as they reflect principles such as precision, consistency, and continuous improvement, which are also important in computing and project work.







Note



üç± Reflection:
The attention to detail in Japanese food culture mirrors the importance of accuracy and care in technical and analytical work.

title: My Travel Experience
text:
Reflection and Personal Growth
Traveling in Japan encouraged me to become more observant, adaptable, and respectful of cultural differences.
Navigating transportation systems, understanding social norms, and managing daily plans independently strengthened my confidence and problem-solving skills.
This experience reinforced the importance of designing systems‚Äîwhether technical or social‚Äîthat are intuitive, reliable, and user-focused.

title: My Travel Experience
section: How This Experience Influences My Studies
text:
How This Experience Influences My Studies
The lessons from this trip influence how I approach my academic work: - Greater appreciation for well-designed systems and workflows
- Improved adaptability when learning new concepts
- Stronger awareness of global perspectives, especially in technology-driven societies
In Applied Computing, understanding user behaviour across different cultures is increasingly valuable.

title: My Travel Experience
text:
Conclusion
Overall, my travel experience in Japan was both inspiring and educational.
It broadened my perspective and continues to influence how I think about design, efficiency, and problem-solving in my academic journey and future professional development.







Note



üìå Final takeaway:
Exposure to different cultures strengthens both personal growth and professional mindset.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text: The primary GenAI tool I used for this assessment was ChatGPT. I chose this tool because it is effective in generating structured content, explaining technical concepts clearly, and supporting problem-solving during the development process. As I was working with Quarto, GitHub, Markdown, and CSS, having a tool that could provide step-by-step explanations and examples helped me better understand unfamiliar workflows and requirements.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text: The primary GenAI tool I used for this assessment was ChatGPT. I chose this tool because it is effective in generating structured content, explaining technical concepts clearly, and supporting problem-solving during the development process. As I was working with Quarto, GitHub, Markdown, and CSS, having a tool that could provide step-by-step explanations and examples helped me better understand unfamiliar workflows and requirements.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
section: 2. How did the GenAI tool help you in completing the assessment (with examples)?
text:
2. How did the GenAI tool help you in completing the assessment (with examples)?
ChatGPT supported me in several practical ways throughout the assessment:

Content structuring: It helped me organise my website pages logically, such as structuring my Self Introduction, Interests, Travel Experience, and Reflection pages with clear headings and coherent flow.
Technical guidance: The tool assisted me in configuring Quarto and GitHub Pages correctly, including understanding how .qmd files are rendered into .html files and how to deploy the site using the /docs folder.
Styling support: It provided guidance on improving my styles.css file, allowing me to enhance the visual appearance of my website while keeping it professional and suitable for academic submission.
Reflection drafting: It helped me brainstorm reflective points and refine my wording so that my reflection was clearer, more structured, and aligned with the assessment rubric.

These examples show how GenAI acted as a support tool rather than replacing my own thinking or work.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
section: 3. What do you think are beneficial about the tool?
text:
3. What do you think are beneficial about the tool?
One major benefit of GenAI tools is their ability to increase efficiency. They help reduce the time spent on trial-and-error by offering clear explanations and examples. The tool is also useful for idea generation, especially when I am unsure how to start writing or structuring content. Additionally, GenAI tools can act as a learning aid by explaining concepts in simpler terms, which supports independent learning.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
section: 4. What do you think are challenging about the tool?
text:
4. What do you think are challenging about the tool?
A key challenge is that GenAI-generated content can sometimes be too generic or not fully aligned with specific requirements. This means I must carefully review, edit, and personalise the output to ensure it reflects my own experiences and understanding. There is also a risk of over-reliance if the tool is used without critical thinking. Therefore, it is important to verify information and ensure that all final decisions are made by the user.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
section: 5. How do you think GenAI tools will assist you in your future study or work?
text:
5. How do you think GenAI tools will assist you in your future study or work?
In future studies and professional work, I believe GenAI tools will be helpful for: - Brainstorming ideas and planning projects
- Drafting and improving documentation or reports
- Debugging code and learning new technical tools more efficiently
- Supporting continuous learning in fast-changing technical fields
When used responsibly, GenAI tools can enhance productivity and support better problem-solving.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
section: 6. Any other thoughts you would like to share?
text:
6. Any other thoughts you would like to share?
Overall, this assessment has shown me that GenAI is most effective when used as a supportive assistant rather than a replacement for learning. By combining GenAI assistance with my own effort, judgement, and reflection, I was able to produce work that better meets the assessment objectives while deepening my understanding of both technical and reflective practices.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
Academic Integrity Statement
While GenAI tools were used to assist with brainstorming, structuring, and technical troubleshooting, all final content, edits, and interpretations represent my own understanding and learning. I reviewed and refined all generated material to ensure accuracy, originality, and alignment with the assessment requirements.

title: Data Visualisation of Singapore Cost of Living (CPI)
text:
1) Inflation Comparison (2023 vs 2024)

What this shows: - Comparison of inflation rates across different CPI measures between 2023 and 2024. - Highlights how inflation changed year-on-year for headline CPI and core measures.

title: Data Visualisation of Singapore Cost of Living (CPI)
text:
2) Inflation Rate by Division (General Households, 2024)

What this shows: - Which categories contributed most to inflation in 2024 (e.g., housing, food, transport, etc.). - Useful for identifying ‚Äúmain drivers‚Äù of cost increases.

title: Data Visualisation of Singapore Cost of Living (CPI)
text:
3) CPI Weighting Pattern (General Households, 2024-Based)

What this shows: - How the CPI basket is weighted across spending groups (e.g., Housing & Utilities, Food, Transport). - Helps explain why some categories influence overall CPI more than others.

title: Data Visualisation of Singapore Cost of Living (CPI)
section: 4) Inflation Rate by Household Income Group (2024)
text:
4) Inflation Rate by Household Income Group (2024)

What this shows: - Differences in inflation experience across income groups. - Can be discussed as how spending patterns vary by household income.

title: Data Visualisation of Singapore Cost of Living (CPI)
text:
Key Takeaways

Overall inflation moderated in 2024 compared to 2023 for headline CPI.
Certain divisions (e.g., Housing & Utilities / Food) were major contributors in 2024.
CPI weighting shows which categories matter most in the final CPI calculation.
Different income groups may face different effective inflation rates.

title: Data Visualisation of Singapore Cost of Living (CPI)
section: 2) Inflation Rate by Division in 2024 (General Households)
text:
2) Inflation Rate by Division in 2024 (General Households)

What this shows: - Which categories contributed most to inflation in 2024 (e.g., housing, food, transport, etc.). - Useful for identifying ‚Äúmain drivers‚Äù of cost increases.
